conclusion: The problem involves analyzing how shadows A, B, C, and D change in position and size when the light source moves to the back left or right.
Shadows are created when objects block light, and their position and size depend on the light source's position and angle.

The image shows four objects above slabs: a cork bulletin board with notes and pins, a small black object (pen or stick), a ring or circular object, and a white cylindrical/hexagonal object with a postcard leaning against it.

The shadows labeled A, B, C, and D are cast on the ground by the objects: shadow A by the black pen/stick, shadow B by the ring, shadow C by the bulletin board, and shadow D by the cylindrical object with the postcard.
Shadows move in the opposite direction from the light source movement.
Shadows grow larger when the light source moves closer to the object and become more elongated when the light source moves lower relative to the object.

premise: The light source moves to the back left.
conclusion: Shadow A will move toward the front right.

premise: The light source moves to the back left.
conclusion: Shadow A will elongate diagonally toward the front right.

premise: The light source moves to the back left.
conclusion: Shadow B will move toward the front right.

premise: The light source moves to the back left.
conclusion: Shadow B will elongate and become more oval-shaped.

premise: The light source moves to the back left.
conclusion: Shadow C will move toward the front right.

premise: The light source moves to the back left.
conclusion: Shadow C will elongate and possibly become more trapezoid-shaped rather than rectangular.

premise: The light source moves to the back left.
conclusion: Shadow D will move toward the front right.

premise: The light source moves to the back left.
conclusion: Shadow D will elongate diagonally toward the front right.

premise: The light source moves to the back right.
conclusion: Shadow A will move toward the front left.

premise: The light source moves to the back right.
conclusion: Shadow A will elongate diagonally toward the front left.

premise: The light source moves to the back right.
conclusion: Shadow B will move toward the front left.
